(from February 9 to April 8, 2011) | longest unbeaten = [[Persib Bandung U-21|Persib U-21]] (6 games)
(from January 23 to April 8, 2011) | longest losses = [[Persijap U-21]] (7 games)
(from January 24, 2011) | prevseason = [[2009-10 Indonesia Super League U-21|2009â10]] | nextseason = [[2011-12 Indonesia Super League U-21|2011-12]] }} The '''2010â11 Indonesia Super League U-21''' season will be the third edition of [[Indonesia Super League U-21]][http://liga-indonesia.co.id/bli/index.php?go=news.clubdetail&type=detail&klub=5 List of ISL U-21 Club participant] (ISL U-21), a companion competition Indonesian super league that are intended for footballers under the age of twenty-one years. [[Persib Bandung U-21|Persib U-21]] is the defending champion in this season. [[Djarum]], an Indonesian tobacco company will continue its participation as the competition's main sponsor. == Format == The competition is divided into three acts consist of two round the group and knockout round. The first round is divided into three groups each containing six clubs, two top teams of each group advanced to the second round. The second half consisted of two groups containing three teams in each group intended, the two best teams from each group advanced to the semifinals. The winner advanced to the final semi-final, while two teams who defeated third-ranked fight. Final winner becomes the champion. == Promotion and relegation == '''Teams promoted to [[Indonesia Super League U-21|ISL U-21]]''' * [[Persibo U-21]] * [[Deltras Sidoarjo U-21]] * [[Semen Padang U-21]] '''Teams relegated''' * [[Persitara U-21]] * [[Persebaya Surabaya U-21]] (''Previous 4th place'') * [[Persik Kediri U-21]] == Round and draw dates == All draws held at PSSI headquarters in [[Jakarta]], [[Indonesia]] unless stated otherwise. {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! Phase ! Round ! Draw date ! Matchday |-align="center" | rowspan=2| Group stage | First Group stage | 15 January 2011 | 19 January - 17 April 2011 |-align="center" | Second Group stage | rowspan=4| 21 April 2011 | 26-30 April 2011 at [[Soemantri Brodjonegoro Stadium|GMSB Stadium]], [[Jakarta]] |-align="center" | rowspan=3| Knockout phase | Semi-finals | 5 May 2011 at [[Soemantri Brodjonegoro Stadium|GMSB Stadium]], [[Jakarta]] |-align="center" | Third place | rowspan=2| 8 May 2011 at [[Soemantri Brodjonegoro Stadium|GMSB Stadium]], [[Jakarta]] |-align="center" | Final |} == First round == [[PSM Makassar U-21]], [[Persema U-21]] and [[Persibo U-21]] withdrawn after the main team of the three U-21 team was withdrawn from [[2010-11 Indonesia Super League|Indonesia Super League]]. Rules for classification: 1st points; 2nd goal difference; 3rd number of goals scored.
(C) = Champion; (R) = Relegated; (P) = Promoted; (O) = Play-off winner; (A) = Advances to a further round.
Only applicable when the season is not finished:
(Q) = Qualified to the phase of tournament indicated; (TQ) = Qualified to tournament, but not yet to the particular phase indicated; (DQ) = Disqualified from tournament. == Second round == ''[[2011 Indonesia Super League U-21 group stage#Second round|2011 Indonesia Super League U-21 Second Round Result]]'' '''Qualify teams:''' [[Persib Bandung U-21]] and [[Semen Padang U-21]] (Group 1), [[Pelita Jaya U-21]] and [[Persela U-21]] (Group 2), [[Persisam Putra U-21]] and [[Persiwa Wamena U-21]] (Group 3). All match play in [[Soemantri Brodjonegoro Stadium|GMSB Stadium]]. The draw for this Round took place on 21 April 2011 with ties to be played on the weekend of 26-30 April 2011. {| class="wikitable" |- !Key to colours in group tables |- bgcolor="#ccffcc" |Group
